intro: Pecteilis eurystoma, commonly known as the broad-leaved pecteilis, is a flowering plant native to parts of East Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes familiar plants like carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its large, compound leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in forested areas. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
